questions.question_title: A char variable can store either an ASCII character or a Unicode character.

options.description: Yes, we can store either an ASCII character or a Unicode character in a char variable.

questions.question_title: If scanf() is used to store a value in a char variable then along with the value a carriage return(\r) also gets stored it.

options.description: No, the carriage return tells the compiler to read the input from the buffer after ENTER key is pressed.

questions.question_title: A short integer is at least 16 bits wide and a long integer is at least 32 bits wide.

options.description:
The basic C compiler is 16 bit compiler, below are the size of it's data types 
The size of short int is 2 bytes wide(16 bits).
The size of long int is 4 bytes wide(32 bits).

questions.question_title: The modulus operator cannot be used with a long double.

options.description:
fmod(x,y) - Calculates x modulo y, the remainder of x/y.
 
This function is the same as the modulus operator. But fmod() performs floating point or long double divisions.
